channel.title: Looking for a affordable gaming pc [Lost_My_Google_Button]
channel.description:
[center][img]http://eric.extremeboredom.net/images/bart-google.gif[/img][/center]
[center]Hello everyone!
Can anyone please recommend or show me any affordable nice gaming pcs. I understand the cheapest and most sucessful way of finding a pc that meets my exact needs it to build my own also, so also i would be really happy with any guides you could find for me :) But at the moment i'd prefer to buy one for i am a lazy bastard :|
This could be a laptop, or a desktop pc. (By PC i mean with the expected package (Monitor, keyboard, speakers, mouse etc)
I will be also looking myself so please don't post saying 'l2google' or 'GOOGLE FOUND THIA FOR JOO YOU SPOON' or anything of that kind, for i am just asking if anyone can recommend to me or help me in any way :)
Affordable in this case will probally mean up to £1500 at the total [b]MAX![/b] i am a poor little budda :(
Thanks for reading and i hope you can help ;)[/center]

item.title: Looking for a affordable gaming pc [Lost_My_Google_Button]
item.dc:creator: @maru maru
item.description:
@maru wrote:

Don’t go with a laptop for gaming

There are some ‘ok’ Dell computers for around your price that would handle well. Of course, lots of people would recommend Alienware, but they add about £200 for the case it comes in.

There are some decent Packard Bells that you should take a look at as well. You could, instead of building it, buy the parts and look for a company or business that will build the computer for you. There are plenty about, as my cousin has his own, and is always moaning about the competition locally.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for a affordable gaming pc [Lost_My_Google_Button]

CAS: CoolerMaster Mystique 632 Tower 420W Case [+29] (Black Color)

OS: NONE - FORMAT HARD DRIVE ONLY [-42]

item.dc:creator: @daycrawler daycrawler
item.description:
@daycrawler wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:24, topic:133558”][quote author=daycrawler link=topic=184808.msg1677956#msg1677956 date=1187239178]
So. Your dad is a moron. I bought a $350 dollar computer from Dell and I have a pentium four, 2.8 ghz processor. That was three years ago. Your dad didn’t look properly. Any website will sell a computer to a sucker who doesn’t care to look further. Dell is good and your arguement is pathetic.
[/quote]

Uhh… Right now their cheapest computer is $349 (no monitor), with an 2.0 GHz AMD X2. I doubt 3 years ago you got a 2.8 GHz Pentium IV for $350. Especially when the price of a 2.8 GHz Northwood is $74.00 now.[/quote]
I did. I can take a picture of my sales receipt.

item.title: Looking for a affordable gaming pc [Lost_My_Google_Button]
item.dc:creator: @daycrawler daycrawler
item.description:
@daycrawler wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:22, topic:133558”][quote author=daycrawler link=topic=184808.msg1676073#msg1676073 date=1187167720]
Uh. Actually they are. I haven’t had a single problem with mine and I’ve owned it for 3+ years. Dell is rock solid with their customer service. Not to mention that computer comes with a 3 year full coverage warranty. Dell doesn’t suck and I don’t understand why people think they do. It’s obvious that with that computer they use name brand parts and don’t use third party parts like people claim they do. So you can stfu and read the computer specs. then you would realize that it’s a good computer for gaming. Until you have sufficent proof that Dell is “Not-sweet” and I mean sufficent and not some bullcrap bias website that shows slanted graphs and stats to discredit their competetion. Thanks…
[/quote]

My dad bought me a $500 Dell. It has a Celeron D processor. End of story.[/quote]
So. Your dad is a moron. I bought a $350 dollar computer from Dell and I have a pentium four, 2.8 ghz processor. That was three years ago. Your dad didn’t look properly. Any website will sell a computer to a sucker who doesn’t care to look further. Dell is good and your arguement is pathetic.

Read full topic

Not to mention that computer comes with a 3 year full coverage warranty. Dell doesn’t suck and I don’t understand why people think they do.
